name: Proxmox System Monitor - VM Status, Host Resources & Temperature Alerts via Telegram

parameters.command:
=# Temperature sensors
sensors 2>/dev/null | grep -E 'Package|Core' || echo 'No temperature data available'

# Detailed uptime
uptime

parameters.content:
## Proxmox Monitoring Workflow

Monitors your Proxmox VE server every 15 minutes and sends automated reports via Telegram.

Tracks VM status, host resources, temperature sensors, and recently stopped VMs.

## CONFIGURATION REQUIRED

1. Set your Proxmox IP, port, and node name
2. Enter Proxmox username (with realm, e.g. root@pam)
3. Add your Proxmox password
4. Set your Telegram Chat ID

Requires: lm-sensors installed on Proxmox host

## Authentication Flow

Logs into Proxmox API to obtain:
- Session ticket (valid 15 minutes)
- CSRF prevention token

Both are required for subsequent API calls

## Data Collection

Gathers data from Proxmox API:
- VM list and status
- Recent task log (stop/shutdown events)
- Node resources (CPU, memory, uptime)

Runs sequentially to ensure authenticated requests

## SSH Temperature Check

Connects via SSH to read temperature sensors using the sensors command.

Requires SSH Password credential configured with your Proxmox host details.

## Data Processing

Analyzes all collected data:
- Counts running/stopped VMs
- Detects VMs stopped in last 15 minutes
- Calculates resource usage percentages
- Evaluates temperature thresholds
- Formats uptime statistics

Generates structured report with HTML formatting for Telegram

## TELEGRAM CONFIGURATION

1. Create bot via @BotFather
2. Get bot token and add as credential
3. Chat ID already set in Set Variables node

Messages use HTML parse mode for formatting
